parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

schemas.name: GetResponse
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an app state resource.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string appstate#getResponse.

schemas.name: ListResponse
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template to convert a list-response for app state.

fields.name: maximumKeyCount
fields.desc: The maximum number of keys allowed for this user.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string appstate#listResponse.

schemas.name: UpdateRequest
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for a requests which update app state

fields.name: data
fields.desc: The new app state data that your application is trying to update with.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string appstate#updateRequest.

schemas.name: WriteResult
schemas.desc: This is a JSON template for an app state write result.

fields.name: currentStateVersion
fields.desc: The version of the data for this key on the server.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Uniquely identifies the type of this resource. Value is always the fixed string appstate#writeResult.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves the data corresponding to the passed key. If the key does not exist on the server, an HTTP 404 will be returned.

pathParams.name: stateKey
pathParams.desc: The key for the data to be retrieved.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists all the states keys, and optionally the state data.

optinalQueryParams.name: includeData
optinalQueryParams.desc: Whether to include the full data in addition to the version number

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Update the data associated with the input key if and only if the passed version matches the currently stored version. This method is safe in the face of concurrent writes. Maximum per-key size is 128KB.

pathParams.name: stateKey
pathParams.desc: The key for the data to be retrieved.

optinalQueryParams.name: currentStateVersion
optinalQueryParams.desc: The version of the app state your application is attempting to update. If this does not match the current version, this method will return a conflict error. If there is no data stored on the server for this key, the update will succeed irrespective of the value of this parameter.

methods.name: clear
methods.desc: Clears (sets to empty) the data for the passed key if and only if the passed version matches the currently stored version. This method results in a conflict error on version mismatch.

pathParams.name: stateKey
pathParams.desc: The key for the data to be retrieved.

optinalQueryParams.name: currentDataVersion
optinalQueryParams.desc: The version of the data to be cleared. Version strings are returned by the server.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Deletes a key and the data associated with it. The key is removed and no longer counts against the key quota. Note that since this method is not safe in the face of concurrent modifications, it should only be used for development and testing purposes. Invoking this method in shipping code can result in data loss and data corruption.

pathParams.name: stateKey
pathParams.desc: The key for the data to be retrieved.
